intro: Peucedanum japonicum var. japonicum, commonly known as Japanese cowparsley, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats. Its aromatic foliage and showy flowers make it a valuable addition to gardens and ecological landscapes.
